New Records: Mexico secured a 4-2 penalty shootout win over Honduras to advance to the 2024 Copa America
Key Match Events: Luis Chávez scored a goal in the 43rd minute
Edson Álvarez scored an injury-time equalizer in the 101st minute
Pre-Game Insights: Mexico needed to respond after a 2-0 loss in the first leg
Mexico made several substitutions in the second half to maintain pressure
Post-Match Reflections: Mexico's coach praised the team's resilience and penalty shootout performance
Honduras will face a do-or-die match for Copa America qualification
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Estadio Azteca with a capacity of 70,078 fans
Mexico will face Colombia in a friendly on December 16
Others: Honduras's next match is a do-or-die play-in for Copa America qualification
Mexico's next significant match is in the Nations League semifinals in March 2024
